ayahEn: ˹And˺ by the heavens in their marvellous design!
Surely you are ˹lost˺ in conflicting views ˹regarding the truth˺.
Only those ˹destined to be˺ deluded are turned away from it.
Condemned are the liars—
those who are ˹steeped˺ in ignorance, totally heedless.
They ask ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?”
˹It is˺ the Day they will be tormented over the Fire.

ayahArV1: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
ayahArV2: ذوقوا فتنتكم هذا الذي كنتم به تستعجلون
ayahEn: ˹They will be told,˺ “Taste your torment! This is what you sought to hasten.”
Indeed, the righteous will be amid Gardens and springs

ayahArV1: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
ayahArV2: اخذين ما اتاهم ربهم انهم كانوا قبل ذلك محسنين
ayahEn: ˹joyfully˺ receiving what their Lord will grant them. Before this ˹reward˺ they were truly good-doers ˹in the world˺:

ayahArV1: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
ayahArV2: كانوا قليلا من الليل ما يهجعون
ayahEn: they used to sleep only little in the night
and pray for forgiveness before dawn.
And in their wealth there was a rightful share ˹fulfilled˺ for the beggar and the poor.
There are ˹countless˺ signs on earth for those with sure faith
as there are within yourselves. Can you not see?
In heaven is your sustenance and whatever you are promised.

ayahArV1: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
ayahArV2: فورب السماء والارض انه لحق مثل ما انكم تنطقون
ayahEn: Then by the Lord of heaven and earth! ˹All˺ this is certainly as true as ˹the fact that˺ you can speak!

ayahArV1: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلْمُكْرَمِينَ
ayahArV2: هل اتاك حديث ضيف ابراهيم المكرمين
ayahEn: Has the story of Abraham’s honoured guests reached you ˹O Prophet˺?

ayahArV1: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
ayahArV2: اذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلاما قال سلام قوم منكرون
ayahEn: ˹Remember˺ when they entered his presence and greeted ˹him with˺, “Peace!” He replied, “Peace ˹be upon you˺!” ˹Then he said to himself,˺ “˹These are˺ an unfamiliar people.”

ayahArV1: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
ayahArV2: فراغ الى اهله فجاء بعجل سمين
ayahEn: Then he slipped off to his family and brought a fat ˹roasted˺ calf
and placed it before them, asking, “Will you not eat?”

ayahArV1: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍ
ayahArV2: فاوجس منهم خيفة قالوا لا تخف وبشروه بغلام عليم
ayahEn: ˹They did not eat,˺ so he grew fearful of them. They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him good news of a knowledgeable son.

ayahArV1: فَأَقْبَلَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ فِى صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
ayahArV2: فاقبلت امراته في صرة فصكت وجهها وقالت عجوز عقيم
ayahEn: Then his wife came forward with a cry, clasping her forehead ˹in astonishment˺, exclaiming, “˹A baby from˺ a barren, old woman!”

ayahArV1: قَالُوا۟ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
ayahArV2: قالوا كذلك قال ربك انه هو الحكيم العليم
ayahEn: They replied, “Such has your Lord decreed. He is truly the All-Wise, All-Knowing.”
